Skirmishers.description: Sword-wielding skeletal minions that deal {value}% increased damage but have {value2}% reduced Life.

Upgrade #1.description: You can raise one additional Skirmisher Warrior.

Upgrade #2.description: Each time you Critically Strike, your Skirmishers' next attack Critically Strikes and deals {value}% bonus Critical Strike damage.

Sacrifice.description: Your Critical Strike Chance is increased by {value}%, but you can no longer raise Skeletal Warriors.

Upgrade #1.description: Every {value} seconds your Skeletal Defenders Taunt enemies.

Sacrifice.description: You gain {value}% Resistance to All Elements, but you can no longer raise Skeletal Warriors.

Reapers.description: Wields a powerful scythe that has a special wind-up attack, dealing heavy damage every {value} seconds.

Upgrade #1.description: Reapers' wind-up attacks now reduce one of your active Cooldowns by {value} second.

Upgrade #2.description: Reapers have a {value}% chance to carve the flesh off enemies, forming a Corpse.

Sacrifice.description: You deal {value}% increased Shadow damage, but you can no longer raise Skeletal Warriors.

Shadow.description: Shadow Mages wield power from the beyond, firing piercing shadow bolts.

Upgrade #1.description: You deal {value}% increased damage for each active Shadow Mage.

Upgrade #2.description: Shadow Mages fire an additional shadow bolt every {value} attacks.

Sacrifice.description: Your Essence Regeneration is increased by {value}% and your maximum Essence is increased by {value2}, but you can no longer raise Skeletal Mages.

Cold.description: Cold Mages assault enemies with chilling attacks that eventually freeze their targets.

Upgrade #1.description: Each time your Cold Mages damage enemies with their primary attack, you gain {value} Essence.

Upgrade #2.description: Cold Mages' attacks apply Vulnerable for {value} seconds.

Sacrifice.description: You deal {value}% increased damage to Vulnerable enemies, but you can no longer raise Skeletal Mages.

Bone.description: Bone Mages use their own bodies as projectiles, dealing heavy damage at the cost of their own Life.

Upgrade #1.description: Every {value}th attack from your Bone Mages makes enemies Vulnerable for {value2} seconds.

Upgrade #2.description: Each time a Bone Mage dies from its own attack, they leave behind a Corpse and Fortify you for {value}% of your Maximum Life.

Sacrifice.description: Your Overpower damage is increased by {value}%, but you can no longer raise Skeletal Mages.

Bone.description: A horrid protector that taunts enemies, forcing them to attack the Golem.

Upgrade #1.description: Activating your Golem's ability causes it to shed {value} Corpses.

Upgrade #2.description: When your Bone Golem takes damage, it unleashes Bone Spikes dealing {value}-{value2} damage and makes enemies Vulnerable for {value3} seconds. This effect can only happen once every {value4} seconds.

Sacrifice.description: You gain {value}% increased Attack Speed, but you lose the ability to summon a Golem.

Blood.description: Drains Life from nearby enemies to heal and bolster itself.

Upgrade #1.description: Your Blood Golem absorbs {value}% of damage you would take.

Upgrade #2.description: When Blood Golem heals itself using its active ability, its next attack deals {value}% increased damage.

Sacrifice.description: Your Maximum Life is increased by {value}%, but you lose the ability to summon a Golem.

Iron.description: An amalgamation of steel that slams the ground and stuns enemies.

Upgrade #1.description: Every {value}th Iron Golem attack causes a shockwave, dealing {value2}-{value3} damage to the primary enemy and enemies behind them.

Upgrade #2.description: Your Iron Golem's slam attack also pulls in enemies.

Sacrifice.description: You deal {value}% increased Critical Strike Damage, but you lose the ability to summon a Golem.
